p: More than one plant part is known/used medicinally for 54% of the wild plants mentioned in Georgia and 57% of them in Turkey. Most commonly, the leaves is given for 27% of the URs in Georgia and 26% of URs in Turkey (TableÂ 2). Plantago spp. constitute majority of the leaf use reports in both countries. The use of aerial parts with flower comes after leaf use in both countries. Most of the contribution to this use originates from Helichrysum spp., Achillea millefolium, Mentha longifolia and Origanum vulgare. Fruits have also similar use percentage in each country. Rosa spp., Sambucus spp., and Crateagus spp. are frequently used species for their fruits in the study area.
